fields.label: What date do you expect your business to start being liable for duty on biofuels or other fuel substitutes?
What is the start point for the duty?
fields.infoText:
You start being liable for duty when a biofuel or other fuel substitute is first, sent out from your premises, set aside, or used as a motor fuel. 

A biofuel or fuel substitute is 'set aside' when the decision has been made to use it as a motor fuel. For example, when its container is labelled as a motor fuel.

fields.infoText:
By submitting this registration you confirm that the information you have provided is true and complete. 

If you do not give complete and accurate information, HMRC may charge a financial penalty or even prosecute you.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted registration.

To complete this registration you must provide us with more details about your premises using an additional form.

The form you need to use depends on the type of business you are registering:

* if the business is a limited company or limited liability partnership (LLP) you'll need to complete and send form [EX103A Excise entry: incorporated company](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-entry-incorporated-company-ex103a) for each of your premises

* if the business is a sole trader or partnership you'll need to complete and send form [EX103 Excise entry: private trader](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-entry-private-trader-ex103) for each of your premises

HMRC will then send you a questionnaire, which you must complete and return to us.
##If the business is a partnership or limited liability partnership (LLP)
You must also inform HMRC of this, so that we can ask you for details about the partnership. You'll need to email HMRC on, enquiries.eeitts@hmrc.gov.uk to tell us.
##If you want to apply to defer duty payments

You'll need to check [Excise Notice 179: motor and heating fuels - general information and accounting for Excise Duty and VAT](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-notice-179-motor-and-heating-fuels-general-information-and-accounting-for-excise-duty-and-vat/excise-notice-179-motor-and-heating-fuels-general-information-and-accounting-for-excise-duty-and-vat#section100) on GOV.UK for details about how to apply for deferment.
